case_data.name: Ohio Legal Rights Service v. Sunshine Group Home
case_data.summary:
This is a case about a Protection and Advocacy (P&A) agency’s records access authority.

The case began in May 2012, when a former resident of an adult care facility complained to Ohio P&A (plaintiff) about the conditions of the home and abuse and neglect that occurred there. Plaintiff initiated its own investigation and spoke with current and former residents and, with their consent, requested the records of those individuals from the facility. The facility refused to grant access.  

On June 29, 2012, plaintiff filed this lawsuit in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Ohio Western Division. Plaintiff filed this lawsuit against defendant facility and the owner and operator of defendant facility under the Protection and Advocacy for Individuals with Mental Illness Act (PAIMI Act) and Ohio state law. Represented by itself, plaintiff sought declaratory and injunctive relief that required defendant to provide access to the requested records.

Plaintiff voluntarily dismissed the lawsuit on September 24, 2012. The reasons for the dismissal are unknown at this time.
case_data.summary_short:
This is a case about a Protection and Advocacy (P&A) agency’s records access authority.

The case began in May 2012 after allegations of abuse in an adult care facility. Plaintiff initiated its own investigation and spoke with current and former residents and, with their consent, requested the records of those individuals from the facility. The facility refused to grant access.  

On June 29, 2012, plaintiff filed this lawsuit in the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Ohio Western Division. Plaintiff filed this lawsuit against defendant facility and the owner and operator of defendant facility under the Protection and Advocacy for Individuals with Mental Illness Act (PAIMI Act) and Ohio state law. Represented by itself, plaintiff sought declaratory and injunctive relief that required defendant to provide access to the requested records.

Plaintiff voluntarily dismissed the lawsuit on September 24, 2012. The reasons for the dismissal are unknown at this time.

documents.title: Plaintiff’s Notice of Voluntary Dismissal Without Prejudice
documents.text:
Case: 1:12-cv-00502-SAS-KLL Doc #: 6 Filed: 09/24/12 Page: 1 of 1  PAGEID #: 23
IN THE UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT 
SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF OHIO 
WESTERN DIVISION 
OHIO LEGAL RIGHTS SERVICE       :     Case No. 1:12-cv-502 
                 : 
Plaintiffs               : 
                 :    Judge Spiegel 
-v-                  : 
                 :    Magistrate Judge Litkovitz 
SUNSHINE GROUP HOME, ET AL.        : 
                 : 
Defendants.               : 
 
PLAINTIFF’S NOTICE OF VOLUNTARY DISMISSAL WITHOUT PREJUDICE 
Plaintiff, Ohio Legal Rights Service, hereby voluntarily dismisses, without prejudice, its 
claims against Defendants pursuant to Fed. R. Civ. P. 41(a)(1)(A)(i). 
Respectfully submitted, 
 
/s/ Susan G. Tobin     
Susan G. Tobin (0021725) 
Chief Legal Counsel 
Ohio Legal Rights Service  
50 W. Broad Street, Suite 1400  
Columbus, Ohio  43215-5923 
Telephone:  (614) 466-7264, ext. 132 
Facsimile:  (614) 644-1888 
stobin@olrs.state.oh.us 
 
 
CERTIFICATE OF SERVICE 
The undersigned hereby certifies that the foregoing Plaintiff’s Notice of Voluntary 
Dismissal Without Prejudice was filed on September 24, 2012, with the Clerk of Court using the 
CM/ECF system, which will provide notice of such filing to all registered parties. 
/s/ Susan G. Tobin     
Susan G. Tobin (0021725)
